question: Well, then it's all for naught, ain't it, Hawkings? I know you --
You want to come along quiet?
Leg's all banged-up. He made a stupid play ... He'll limp around the yard up at Folsom. But Astricky will be there to take care of him. With their priors, they're looking at a serious bounce --
How's that?
answer: Let them go. And I'll leave ...

question: You'll leave -- ?
answer: You don't have anything on me. A misdee auto-theft. I got no record. I'll be out in three days, and back at it. Or you let them go, and I give you my word. I'm gone. And without the ringleader ... Your tee-times have just grown exponentially...

question: Get out of here, then. Now. Leave the car, Randall ... Arright, let lim go. Cite him for rolling the stop ... And cite old Atley for driving to endanger ... Just like that. Quit your bellyaching, Hawkings ... And let's wrap this up ...
answer: You know what you got here? There's excessive resistance in the cranking circuit ... You know what you gotta do -- ? You have any other answers besides "not really"? Right. You want to test the voltage drop ... Use the voltmeter ... Remove the primary lead from the ignitioncoil and crank her ... See what you got ... You understand -- ? Those things'll kill ya, Budgy -- 1980 Mercury Cougar. 255 cubic inch V8 ... Based on the Ford Thunderbird bodyshell; they modified the chassis, but didn't improve its performance... That I did, Budgy. That I did -- Excuse me --

question: Hello, Atley ... How's the leg?
answer: Only hurts when I breathe. Lookit you. Where are Barney Fife and Aunt Bea hanging out? And Opie ... Where's Opie at?

question: What are you doing here?
answer: Is there someplace we can talk?

question: What about?
answer: About your brother. And the deeeep shit he's in --

question: Thanks, Donna --
answer: It's been a long time, Memphis --

question: Six years ...
answer: Six years. Shit. Time flies, don't it? Six years ago we were fartin' through Armani and pissin' Cristal. Now look at us ...

question: Tell me about Kip -
answer: He took a job. And he fumbled it. Now he's jammed-up. Jammed-up bad...

question: A boost? What's Kip doing on a boost?
It seems she neglected to mention it
answer: Maybe she don't know. Although I don't see how that could be. Maybe she didn't want to upset you -

question: Don't feel the need to explore my family dynamics, Atley...
early 60s, clear-eyed... In pink Ruby's uniform and chunky shoes... Black currant hair striated with wisps of gray... Helen delivers the plates to a booth of college kids ... Sure, hon ...
answer: Who's a guy gotta know to get a tuna melt in this joint -- ? How ya doing, Ruby -- ?

question: oh.
answer: Atley Jackson came to see me ...

question: Atley Jackson. How is that one? How's the leg... ?
I couldn't. I didn't want you to worry. I thought held sort himself out. I hardly see him. He comes and goes. He's in trouble, isn't he?
I knew it. He's changed, Randall. He's a different boy. He's lost that... That sweetness ... It's gone ... And I don't know what to do ...
Of course ...
answer: He doesn't return my calls. or my letters ...

question: Why you gotta front me like that? I'm talking to Kip --
answer: Why don't you leave him alone?

question: I known Kip longing than you, man ...
answer: Oooh, ain't you the lucky duck --

question: Any word, Kip -- ?
answer: No ... And they won't take my calls ...

question: What does that mean -- ?
answer: It ain't what you'd call a "good sign"

question: But we only got till Friday. That's four days. And we lost the 13. So's we gotta start over ...
answer: That, too ... Don't sweat it, Freb. We're cool. It can be done, man. We just gotta step it up... It's a challenge ...

question: Now. Where were we? Oh, yes. Kip.
I'm proud of this work. The bird feeder. The wagon wheel planter. The dollhouse. The drop-leaf movable server...
answer: I'm sure you're working your way to the point. I'll wait right here ...

question: My point. Yes. Simple, really. I require the best. I insist on the best. I only engage the best. Your brother. His friends. They came to me. They wanted my paper. He was your brother. You were the best. Now. They've brought so much goddamn heat down, I may not be able to fill this order. Which would be very bad for me. Which in turn, is very bad for them...
answer: I could kill you. That occurred to me. When I first heard about this. That I would kill you ...

question: Grow up. You don't kill people like me. People like me die in their sleep at 87 ... Do you know why? Because if you did kill me, and everyone knew it was you - for the next ten years they'd be finding pieces of those you love scattered all over California ...
answer: I can come up with the front money. Pay you back...

question: Were it only that easy. I have obligations. The order needs to be filled...
answer: They gave you only four days?

question: They gave me two weeks. I wasted most of it with your brother and his crew, who not only lost what pitiful few they managed to boost, but also alerted the heat as to our endeavor, making this even more difficult to achieve ...
I knew you'd say that.
answer: I'm just here about my brother.

question: I knew you'd say that, too --
Your brother has four days. Fifty cars. Five-zero. For that he gets 200 large ...
answer: And if he doesn't make it -- ?

question: I made this, too. My first one. Brass extension handles, not plated. The coverings are silk, not rayon. Expensive hardwood. And lined with spray green Lorraine crepe ...
You know my back.
answer: When'd you get to town, Raines?

question: No particular reason. Catch a Laker game. I heard we got Shaquille ...
Just out there. Roaming around. Building up my collection of refrigerator magnets ...
Not at all ...
answer: I remember us having made some kind of deal, Randall. I don't remember this deal having some kind of time-limit. I look at you - here - in my town - and I'm confused...

question: A little family emergency --
answer: I hope it's not your dear sweet mother...

question: No...
answer: Or your baby brother. What was his name?

question: Kip.
answer: Yes, Kip. Short for Kipling. Named for the English writer of stories about India ... He bites into his pear ... Memphis says nothing, waits ...

question: And this has what to do with me?
answer: I don't know. But you shouldn't be here. Take care of your business. I'll give you 24 hours. And then I don't want to see your face. Ever again. Make a fool of me once, that's my bad. Make a fool of me twice. That's really my bad, and I'll kick your ass from here to India ... Good. Cos you know how it plays. Six years ago, I let you go free. But the next time ... The next time sends you away for'a long, long while ...

question: Sure -
answer: How'd you get here? Your Moms give you ride -- ?

question: Hell, no. I boosted a 'Vette.
answer: You boosted a 'Vette? Then where is it?

question: I dunno. It was right here. Someone musta' boosted it back...
answer: Damn crooks is everywhere -- Yeah. Except the only thing he's growing is old... Don't you do that! You leave him alone! He's got nothing to do with this --

question: Damn crooks is everywhere -- Yeah. Except the only thing he's growing is old... Don't you do that! You leave him alone! He's got nothing to do with this --
We can still do it --
answer: No you can't. Flies on sherbert is what you remind me of. Because just being attracted to something, doesn't mean you belong...

question: I get out of this I'm gonna fuck you up --
I think so. There's things I can't feel right now. Like my feet. But ... You think you can get me outta this, Memphis? I'd appreciate it -
This has nothing to do with any of that --
answer: Oh. You maybe have more than one enemy who owns a car-crusher -- ?

question: All my enemies own car crushers. It's like a pre-requisite ... Owwww...
answer: Easy ... Take it easy ... We're almost there... You okay -- ?

question: Totally. I'm fine. You want a beer, man -- ?
you like Kobe's game? I do. You think he's heir apparent to MJ? I do. He speaks fluent Italian, you know? So he's got that going for him --
Yeah, man. Where is your beer? Cool. So you're living up North?
I heard you were pumping gas -
You're kind of cultivating a new look.
Hey, you want something to eat ?
Not much. I got olives. You like olives? Kalamata olives rule, I think. Ma likes the Calabrese. It's more mellow
answer: There's certainly a time and a place for a mellow olive -

question: Yeah, yeah. That's what I'm thinking --
answer: So what are you gonna do?

question: About Calitri? No worries, man. I'll call him. He's a reasonable dude ...
Yeah. He just wants to know I'm still on it. He needs reassurance. All these big swinging dicks do. No worries. I won't let him get into our Kool-Aid...
What?
answer: You just got crushed in a car. You're bleeding all over your self. And you sit there - eating olives and talking basketball, as if, at this very moment, people weren't plotting your demise ...

question: C'mon, man... My "demise..." Overreaction
answer: "Over--" You know - I can maybe understand, since I been gone, you taking up this dumb-ass life of crime, and for that I can partly blame myself. But what is baffling to me, is how, since I been gone, you've become a complete and total moron--

question: Nicolo, how's the yellowtail today? You can't get it any fresher than this, Memphis ... From the sea to my skillet ... Nothing in between...
We can learn something from our Asian friends. They smoke a thousand cigarettes a day; they're completely stressed and overworked; they drink like, well ...
And they still have the lowest rate of cancer of anywhere in the world. You know why? All they eat is seafood.
answer: Also, never underestimate the restorative powers of "Karaoke."

question: I do a poaching number. Six-ounce fillets in a saucepan of brine. In 8 minutes, I could cater a goddamn wedding. Plain but flavorful. And it's a good way to show off my Hollandaise sauce ...
I do ... Christ, what happened to us ?
answer: Speak for yourself, boss I don't have a Hollandaise sauce

question: No, but you dress like an asshole ...
answer: I think about that night a lot...

question: Me, too. Every time I walk...
answer: How they were just there ... Waiting on us ... The fix was definitely in ...

question: Yeah -- ?
answer: Yeah Tell him to lay off Kip and them Tell him it's on

question: Am I dying? Are all the angels of my life returning to bid a final farewell? And have my angels completely lost their fashion sense -- ?
You remember Junie?
answer: Of course. Hi, Junie -- What happened here -- ?

question: Whatever do you mean?
answer: The chop-shop... Where are the stripped cars? The rolled-back odometers? The part bins?

question: What happened? Old-age happened. I tired of killing them. I woke up one morning and thought I am no longer a destroyer. I am a means of resurrection. Now. We restore. We revive. There are so few things in this life, we can prevent from decay. Most must die. These don't have to...
I heard rumors you were back. About Kip ...
I can't concentrate. Play something, my sweetness; my reason to rise ...
answer: You think it can be done?

question: Are you considering a comeback tour?

It can be done. Take two days to shop; one to prep. I'll offer up my bible for a small fee. You also have to hope Kip's jerk-circus didn't undo Castlebeck's linkage so much so that he's setting up surveillance teams on every city block. And then get yourself a crew...
"A people is a detour of nature to get 6 or 7 great men - Yes, and then to get around them..." Nietzsche said that.
The old crew. Go find them. I can't help you with that. Since I've cleaned up the act a bit, they no longer come around... A pity how legitimacy makes you unpopular -
answer: I Just don't know how happy they'll be to see me

question: I remember I had a 1964 Buick Opal. worst car ever built. Value job. Everything broke and I-fixed it. A coma car - built to German specs. Plastic gas line. 3 speedometer head. On a quiet night, you could hear it rusting in the garage. But when that car was gone, I missed it. If it came driving back in here right now, there'd be tears and laughter ...
answer: And the moral of that story is -- ?

question: Pull over! Pull her the hell over! You ain't sorry. You're a horrible driver... You can't strap into your seat belt, without almost getting creamed by a bus ... Damn. Memphis Raines. Long time ...
All I get are the Orientals. They can build 'em, but they can't drive 'em So? What are you doing here? What's with the outfit -- ?
answer: You know where the others are?

question: Most of 'em are gone. The Dyar Boys are doing a nickel at Chino; Henry Santoro and Frankie Fish are moving weight in Florida; Bill Doolin was killed in Denver... Atley Jackson's on the gimp and runnin' errands for Calitri; The Sphinx is still around, I guess ... Then of course, there's ...
Okay. Figure it forgotten. What's this about anyways -- ? Most of 'em are late-model...
Yeah...
answer: Well, the three of us don't'exactly inspire confidence...

question: I appreciate your dilemma, Memphis. But how are two washed-up thieves and an old man supposed to boost 50 cars in three days...
answer: His criminal career has officially come to a close ...

question: The conundrum still applies, of course. The purpose of the endeavor is to rescue baby brother from imminent death and/or a life of crime. However. This cannot be successfully carried out without baby brother's considerable resources, shabby though they may be.
answer: We do this. Then. You're finished. Then. You're clean

question: You got maybe a better plan?
answer: You spread it out ... you move around... So's they can't touch you... so's they don't know... Shadow games and shit

question: Yeah. He's knows of one all right.
answer: I think you've had enough, Billy... If you leave now, Billy, you can get a head-start on waking up in a pool of your own vomit... Come back when you've learned how to drink, Billy --

question: See you're still stealing the sailors from the sea --
answer: What are you doing here? What's with the look?

question: The hip, cool, sexy thing was getting old...
answer: You look like you lost your sheep ...

question: You still wrenching at Bacchiochi's?
answer: Hell, yeah. I'm not getting rich in here ...

question: Buy you a drink?
answer: Nope. I got a coffee. And a boyfriend.

question: So I was replaced by Mitch?
answer: No. You were replaced by Alex. Who was replaced by Kevin. Who was replaced by Vince. Who was replaced by Mitch...

question: Wow. And to think all I accomplished these past six years was the "LORD OF THE RINGS" trilogy...
answer: Yeah, well, you always were a sucker for flawed existences ...

question: I've taken the spear for a lot of people, Sway. Including you. Can't we improvise a little here ... ?
answer: No can do. Life goes on, pointfive ... You left me, remember?

question: I left town. I didn't leave you.
And here I am...
answer: Yes. But I got a feeling it's not on account of any longing-for-my-touch on your part -

question: Kip took a job. Fifty ladies in two weeks. Only the two weeks have turned into four days. And not a single lady has been snared.
Six or seven...
answer: I'm not doing it anymore. Haven't for a while. I've carved out something for myself. It's pathetic, but it's mine ...

question: How you doing, pal?
answer: I'd go so far as to say "lovely."

question: You should her face when she's having sex --
Get the damn thing in there and get it cleaned up -
answer: This is loaded with crap - get a duffel.

question: What are you still doing here, Randall?
answer: Stopped by to see Otto. Say hello.

question: Run me down a tag - 329 HRO. Cadillac.
answer: No faith in our new-found goodness, Detective ...?

question: Sure. But sometimes we got to create some numbers. The task force is run by statistics, you know ...
I don't think so, Detective ... Hey -
answer: The photo album. I get nostalgic around this time of year ...

question: You ever wonder what things'd be like if he hadn't died?
answer: Every day. I wonder about that every day...

question: Kip and I'd probably be working at the dealership... Imagine us selling cars?
answer: And just in case you lose your keys, good sir, I can toss in a complimentary slim-jim, free of charge ...

question: Mother -- !
answer: I remember. Supper getting cold, cos you two are out there heads under hoods ...

question: They're just cars, man ...
answer: This Eleanor's been living at the International Towers for 3 years now.

question: Why do you call it "Eleanor?"
answer: All the vehicles get code names. Female names. You say "Eleanor lives at such and such... " and no one listening on the waves is the wiser ...

question: It just ain't happening --
answer: You'll get the hang of it, kid. You just need to remember one thing -

question: What's that?
answer: On boost night? Always take along a good mix tape ...

question: I guess ...
answer: You got a school teacher or Nancy from accounting, you don't put on Sly Stone or James Brown. You put on Ravel. Rachmaninoff. But if you got some wild one you just picked up at the track, you wouldn't put on Cat Stevens or James Taylor. You'd put on Prince. Or Isaac Hayes. Or, if you really wanted to get after it

question: okay ...
answer: It's the same way with cars. Different cars. Different tunes. You can't steal a Maserati listening to Sinatra. You gotta get urgent. You gotta get Sonny Rollins or Led Zeppelin IV, on that shit. But never, never-ever take no Allman Brothers into a Lincoln Town Car. Could lead to disaster. Got it... ?

question: What's wrong with her -- ?
answer: The right side of the engine is running richer than the left. And the scope isn't showing shit... I dunno...

question: Right. Great car. One of a kind. I was looking forward to that boost myself
answer: She was the only "Annie" you could find?

question: They only made a handful. We're lucky there's even one living in the area...
answer: Yeah, well ... She lives with District Court Judge Seymour Croft ... ... and he keeps "Annie' in his living room... Like a work of art ... She's got 27 miles on her o-dom. Which is exactly how far away the custom shop was in 1979 when he bought her... He drove her home, never drove her again ... The man's a freak... She's trouble --

question: I put the boys on it. They're clever that way...
Okay.
answer: You mentioned that in your letters

question: I always thought you'd follow me up.
answer: We were good when you bailed, weren't we?

question: Very good...
answer: Cos there were those dark days, when I figured - my God, how easy it was for him to just give it up; to make the deal; take the rot for the whole crew ... And give me up in the process.

question: No ...
answer: Don't go getting all warm and fuzzy on me, Randall. I'm the jane that was left, and you're the jim that did the leaving. So save the sanctimonious shit for someone who believes. The only reason I ride with you, is cause I don't want to spend the whole night with any of them other creeps!

question: Oh. Okay. Right. I'm on the move -
Not my girl anymore
answer: Yet your still here ... I gave you 24 hours, 24 hours ago ...

question: What do you want from me?
answer: Honestly? I want to - once every few months - get into my car. Pack a lunch. And drive on up to Chino. On visiting day. Bring you some magazines. Maybe some almond clusters. And see you all bright and shiny in your orange jumpsuit. That's what I want ...

question: This one ...
answer: Reads the infrared. Then kills it. Little something the R & D department came up with ...

question: How long were you gonna let me try and stop it...?
answer: After a while, it became a little pathetic ... Figured I'd put you out of your misery ...

question: Ain't we good-timing here ... ?
answer: The family that steals together, deals together...

question: Dad'd be proud --
answer: Maybe not. But Dad was from another era...

question: What era was that -- ?
answer: The era when crime didn't pay --

question: As opposed to now, Kid Car Crusher?
What about just getting a job, 9 to 5, five days a week, that whole mystery achievement -- ?
answer: It's for assholes. The Legal Buck blows, Memphis. You know that. Doing this, we make mad bank, my boys are down, the girlies come around and the boosts are a breeze. Yeah, sure, you're gonna get jacked-up every now and then - but ain't that a small price to pay for never, never-ever, having to say "paper or plastic?"

question: What about me?
answer: You'll be at the docks ... Keeping Otto abreast of our progress ...

question: How come ... ?
answer: Because you should be home with Nintendo, listening to The Spice Girls, little man ...

question: Look at this. A multi-generational gathering of scumbags ...
answer: So saith the God of Scumbags --

question: Hello, Otto. My boys at the dock report no cars have yet to be delivered. And there's only one more night ...
answer: Getting nervous, Ray? What happens to you, I wonder, if delivery isn't made?

question: With all the free time I've had not counting cars as they're loaded onto my ship, I've managed to sand the cedar inside your box, Kip. This will protect you from the anaerobic bacteria, that normally thrives in an airless; environment. Thus prolonging decay ...

okay, sir. Let me just get the-order. Yes. We'll be doing some work out your way. We've got a power leak. And it's unsafe. We're moving residences to the... Marriott Long Beach ... Just for the night ...
Yes, sir -
answer: Okay, then ... I just go to the Marriott and I'm set ...

question: Gosh, no. Lipstick? What next? Mascara, blush, floral-print dresses?
Wow. Bozo, the very sexy clown --
No. I had a girl. She was great. The problem is
answer: She was so great, why'd you leave her?

question: That's strange. I'm nervous. Donny's nervous. Everyone's nervous. But not you...
answer: I dunno. Whatever will be will be...

question: Arright ... Enough ... I can't have you bellying up to my heart again, man, f you can't help falling off the stool. But he puts his mouth to her ears ...
answer: Shhh... Car thieves are your weakness.

question: Woo-woo-wooooo!
answer: I pop your hood; find your siren wires

question: They're factory alarms ... Easy to get around... For a man with... Skills...
Of course you are. You're a professional...
I bet you say that to all the girls...
answer: With a twist of my wrist ... You're turned over ...

question: What about The Club ... ?
answer: Let me worry about The Club ...

question: No worries ...
answer: I've got you floored... We're off ... Take the curb... Man, can you corner... Know not to get on it ... Momentum shift ... Don't get on those brakes too hard ... Get her up on her tires. Up on her toes. Up ... Up... Up.

question: You're still quite the boost, Randall Raines ... Except now I've been chopped, and my parts are in a Honda Prelude being driven to church in South America by some Bolivian consulate's wife ...
You ever feel bad about any of this?
answer: Of course not. I'm Robin Hood. I take from the rich, and give to the needy...

question: You mean the poor --
answer: No. The needy. Us. Cos we need this car! Are you kidding me -- ? I'm stealing this car. So BACK OFF!

question: C'mon, Donny... Let's go, man --
answer: Lazy ... Lazy ... I ask you, Freb

question: I can't leave you here, man --
answer: I'm all right. Been shot before. You take me to the hospital, they bust the both of us. The cops'll take me. Go!

question: They just brought in Donny Astricky. Shot by a jacker ...
He'll live. But it means your boy's behind it. Astricky was holding a list. They just faxed it to us...
answer: Let's get out there. And have them run down every 167 Shelby Mustang in the area ... Find out where they're at.

question: What for?
answer: You spend enough time down a man's throat, you get to know his tonsils. Do it ...

question: Whatcha got left ... ?
answer: "Carol." A 198 Mercedes ... She lives in the suburbs ...

question: We'll take it...
answer: It's ear-marked for Mirror Man and The Sphinx...

question: What did I tell you? What? What did I tell you?
I know. I've missed you, too
Stay here. Stay here a while. I'll be back ...
Kip's not clear yet. We got one more to go --
Is our boy done? Has The Boss Barracuda been grounded -- ? Hello -- ? Is this The Boss Barracuda -- ?
How you doing, man -- ?
answer: The truth is - my car here doesn't have a tape deck. You mind hooking me with up with some driving tunes ?

question: You got it, brother. This one is going out to The Boss Barracuda. Catch him if you can --
Well, well. You've caused quite a ruckus ...
answer: This is number 50. We did it. It's over Where's the money ?

question: Right there -
answer: You should never have gotten my brother and his friends involved ...

question: But I had to. It was the only way to get to you --
answer: Well, now, he's clear. And you'll stay away from him...

question: I don't know about that, Randall. He did such a good job on this paper. And another one just came in ...
answer: You don't want to even sniff at that --

question: Look at it. I can't very well make delivery of that thing ...
answer: You got no choice. It's over.

question: Fifty cars. Fifty cars by 8 AM Friday. Or Kip goes in that box. That was the deal ... Goddamn, it ... That was the deal ...
answer: Tell you what I'm not doing

question: Tell you what I'm not doing
My version of "take this job and shove it..."
answer: Are you crazy? You throw down with The Carpenter? You got a grudge against your life?

question: This is all about there not being a next time, Atley --
Hello, boys -- !
answer: Hey! What happened? Did they make it

question: He's napping. He said to take it away...
answer: That'll do ya. Tell Mr. C. we was by.

question: Absolutely.
answer: Ding Dong The Witch Is Dead, right?

question: What are you doing here?
answer: I saw her get smashed-up on the TV. Knew there was no way he was gonna accept her ...

question: Where'd you find this one?
answer: Ya gotta keep tabs on your "Eleanors", Memphis. Cos you never know when you're gonna need one --

question: You boost her -- ?
answer: Hell, yeah. She's not my unicorn.

question: Move over ... You okay -- ?
answer: I dunno ... I keep thinking about him.

question: Don't look so glum, Detective. It's a beautiful day, the birds are singing, and there's a container ship on Pier 14, that's guaranteed to bring you glee ...
answer: I want you gone, Randall. Settle your affairs. Make it right with those you love. Hell, take 'em with you. But I want you out of here. Out of here for good this time ...

question: You remember where you got this Eleanor -- ?
She's for sale. They're asking forty thousand. Give 'em sixty ...
answer: You want me to buy her?

question: Thought I'd go for a ride -
Seeing if you wanted to go for a ride?
answer: I can't. I got a back load of repairs and one of the mechanics called in sick and I haven't slept and-- Where to -- ?

question: I dunno. I know a place.
